overview.Name: Occidental Petroleum Corporation
overview.Description: Occidental Petroleum Corporation (OXY) is a prominent player in the global oil and gas industry, primarily engaged in exploration and production activities across diverse regions, including the United States, the Middle East, and Colombia. With a strong presence in petrochemical manufacturing, Occidental leverages cutting-edge technologies to enhance operational efficiency and reduce costs. The company is actively committed to sustainability, advancing low-carbon initiatives and positioning itself strategically to adapt to the global energy transition. This proactive stance allows Occidental to effectively manage the challenges of the evolving energy landscape while meeting future energy demands.
overview.Address: 5 GREENWAY PLAZA, HOUSTON, TX, UNITED STATES, 77046-0521

news.sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
news.relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: UBS Group Issues Pessimistic Forecast for Occidental Petroleum (NYSE:OXY) Stock Price
feed.summary: UBS Group has issued a pessimistic forecast for Occidental Petroleum (NYSE:OXY), cutting its price objective from $45.00 to $43.00 while maintaining a "neutral" rating. Despite this, the consensus among analysts remains a "Hold" with an average price target of $49.95. Occidental Petroleum's stock recently traded around $41.07, and the company reported Q3 EPS of $0.64, surpassing estimates, though revenue declined year-over-year.

feed.title: OXY: UBS Maintains Neutral Rating, Lowers Price Target to $43
feed.summary: UBS analyst Josh Silverstein maintained a Neutral rating on Occidental Petroleum (OXY) and lowered the price target from $45 to $43. This adjustment reflects a 4.44% decrease in projected stock value. The consensus among 27 brokerage firms indicates a "Hold" status for OXY, with an average target price of $49.68 from 24 analysts.

feed.title: Most Expensive Stock in the World 2025: Why Berkshire Hathaway’s $755,000 Shares Still Dominate Wall Street
feed.summary: Berkshire Hathaway Class A (BRK.A) remains the world's most expensive stock by share price, trading above $755,000 in late 2025. This high price is primarily due to Warren Buffett's lifelong refusal to split Class A shares, fostering a long-term investor culture. With a market capitalization over $1 trillion, a record cash pile of $382 billion, and a leadership transition as Greg Abel takes over as CEO from Buffett, the company continues to evolve its diverse business empire.

feed.title: Mizuho names Coterra, ConocoPhillips, Permian as top oil and gas picks
feed.summary: Mizuho has updated its top picks in the oil and gas exploration and production sector, naming Coterra Energy, ConocoPhillips, and Permian Resources as its preferred investments, replacing Chord Energy. Despite current negative sentiment due to oversupply concerns, the firm believes there is "underappreciated value" in exploration and production companies based on longer-term fundamentals that could materialize in 2026. Mizuho recommends reallocating risk towards oil exploration and production companies with a selective bias in gas stocks.

feed.title: Epsilon Energy Ltd. Announces Sale of Dewey Energy Holdings, LLC and Western Anadarko Basin Assets for $2.5 Million
feed.summary: Epsilon Energy Ltd. has announced the sale of its wholly owned subsidiary, Dewey Energy Holdings, LLC, including its Western Anadarko basin assets, to an undisclosed private buyer for $2.5 million in cash. This transaction involved the transfer of approximately 813 Mcfe/d of production, 6,400 net deep acres, and 2,200 net shallow acres of leasehold in Dewey County, Oklahoma. RedOaks Energy Advisors LLC facilitated the sale, allowing Epsilon Energy to streamline operations and potentially focus on other core assets.

feed.title: BP, Chevron Top US Gulf Lease Sale
feed.summary: BP PLC and Chevron Corp led the first oil and gas lease auction under the Trump administration's "One Big Beautiful Act," securing 51 and 24 blocks respectively in the Gulf of America. This "Lease Sale Big Beautiful Gulf 1", the first of at least 30 required sales, saw 30 companies participate, submitting 219 bids totaling $371.88 million. The strong bidding reflects sustained industry confidence and a renewed offshore energy strategy aimed at strengthening national security and economic opportunity.

feed.title: State Street Corp Buys 615,566 Shares of Occidental Petroleum Corporation $OXY
feed.summary: State Street Corp increased its stake in Occidental Petroleum Corporation by 1.6% in the second quarter, acquiring an additional 615,566 shares to own a total of 39,044,478 shares worth over $1.6 billion. Other hedge funds also adjusted their positions in OXY, which has a current market capitalization of $41.12 billion. The company recently announced a quarterly dividend of $0.24 per share and reported Q4 earnings per share of $0.64, surpassing analyst estimates.

feed.title: B of A Securities Maintains Neutral Rating on OXY, Lowers Price Target | OXY Stock News
feed.summary: B of A Securities has maintained a "Neutral" rating on Occidental Petroleum (OXY) but reduced its price target from $45.00 to $44.00, reflecting challenges in the energy sector. This adjustment is part of a series of cautious stances from analysts, with the average target price for OXY now at $49.68 from 24 analysts, implying an 18.98% upside from its current price. However, GuruFocus estimates suggest a potential 6.99% downside from its fair value estimate of $38.83.

feed.title: Guggenheim Capital LLC Lowers Stake in Occidental Petroleum Corporation $OXY

feed.title: YPF and partners secure Chile export route for Vaca Muerta shale oil
feed.summary: YPF, along with Shell, Equinor, and Vista, has secured a long-term deal with Chile's ENAP to export Vaca Muerta shale oil to Chile until 2033. This agreement will initially export 70,000 barrels per day and could generate up to $12 billion in export revenue. The deal leverages the refurbished Trans-Andean Oil Pipeline and the new Vaca Muerta Norte oil pipeline, strengthening regional energy partnerships and aiming to boost Argentina's position as an energy supplier.

feed.title: ExxonMobil’s Potential Expansion: A Game Changer?
feed.summary: ExxonMobil is experiencing significant market growth, with its stock trading up 3.54% following a strong earnings report and a "Buy" recommendation from UBS. The company is actively pursuing strategic expansions, including potential acquisitions in Iraq, refinery upgrades in Saudi Arabia with Aramco, and increased LNG production with Chevron in Australia. These moves aim to solidify ExxonMobil's market position, enhance operational efficiency, and capitalize on growing global energy demands.

feed.title: Occidental Petroleum Corporation $OXY Shares Acquired by WINTON GROUP Ltd

feed.title: OxyVinyls reports fire incident at La Porte facility
feed.summary: OxyVinyls, a subsidiary of Occidental Petroleum Corporation, reported a fire incident at its La Porte, Texas facility. The company worked with local officials to address the situation and later confirmed an "all clear" for the incident.

feed.title: Vitesse Energy (NYSE:VTS) Shares Little Changed on Operations
feed.summary: Vitesse Energy (NYSE:VTS) shares remained relatively unchanged following operational updates. The company specializes in managing non-operated oil and natural gas properties, primarily in the Williston Basin across North Dakota and Montana. Operational reliability is maintained through partner oversight, regulatory compliance, and production monitoring.

feed.title: Equifax (NYSE:EFX) Shares Little Changed in Data Sector Focus
feed.summary: Equifax (NYSE:EFX) shares remained largely unchanged as the market focused on the data sector. The article provides an overview of Equifax's global operations, emphasizing its secure, accurate, and compliant data verification, consumer and commercial data solutions, and technological services within the S&P 500 Index sector. The company highlights its commitment to data accuracy through quality assurance, system monitoring, automated verification, encryption, and regulatory compliance.

feed.title: Taylor Stephen Charles sells $642k in natural gas services (NGS)
feed.summary: Director Stephen Charles Taylor sold 20,000 shares of Natural Gas Services Group INC (NASDAQ:NGS) for over $642,000 on December 4, 2025. The company's stock is trading near its 52-week high with a strong 31.8% price return over the past six months, though its P/E ratio appears high relative to near-term earnings growth. Recent Q3 2025 earnings surpassed analyst expectations, leading Stifel to raise its price target and maintain a Buy rating.

feed.title: Occidental Petroleum Corporation (NYSE:OXY) Passed Our Checks, And It's About To Pay A US$0.24 Dividend
feed.summary: Occidental Petroleum (NYSE:OXY) is set to pay a US$0.24 dividend, with the ex-dividend date in four days, allowing shareholders to receive payment on January 15th if shares are bought before December 10th. The company's dividend appears sustainable, supported by a rapid 38% annual earnings growth over the past five years and healthy payout ratios from both earnings and free cash flow. Despite a historical dividend decline over 10 years, its current financial health suggests promising dividend prospects.

feed.title: Evaluating ConocoPhillips (COP) Stock's Actual Performance
feed.summary: ConocoPhillips (COP) has significantly trailed the S&P 500 over the past one- and three-year periods despite its attractive dividend. However, it has outperformed the S&P 500 over the last five years, especially when considering reinvested dividends, largely due to strategic acquisitions that have improved its portfolio and positioned it to generate more free cash flow even at lower oil prices. The company's recent performance has been heavily influenced by fluctuating oil prices and its efforts to build a stronger, low-cost operating base.

feed.title: Bulls Charge Ahead as APA Corporation Shares Surge
feed.summary: APA Corporation shares surged due to significant institutional buying pressure, pushing the stock beyond analyst price targets. The rally is supported by strong quarterly earnings and an attractive valuation, despite analysts maintaining a "Hold" rating. Institutional activity, particularly by Prudential Financial Inc., has been a major catalyst for the stock's performance.

feed.title: 3 Warren Buffett Stocks to Buy and Hold Forever
feed.summary: This article identifies three "forever stocks" that Warren Buffett expects Berkshire Hathaway to own indefinitely: Coca-Cola, American Express, and Occidental Petroleum. It explains that these companies are characterized by successful base businesses, worldwide brands, and essential products/services. The piece encourages investors to add these stocks to their watchlists and buy them when they trade below their fair value estimates.

feed.title: Exxon Mobil (XOM) Stock: What to Watch Before the December 1, 2025 Market Open
feed.summary: This article provides an in-depth analysis of Exxon Mobil (XOM) stock ahead of the December 1, 2025 market open, highlighting its strong cash flows, increased dividend, and analyst sentiment despite a softer oil-price backdrop. It details recent OPEC+ decisions, institutional investor movements, and Exxon's strategic shifts in hydrogen projects and pipeline infrastructure. The analysis concludes with key factors for investors to watch, reinforcing XOM's position as a cash-rich, dividend-growing energy major with a premium valuation.

feed.title: Occidental Petroleum Corporation (NYSE:OXY) is largely controlled by institutional shareholders who own 51% of the company
feed.summary: Institutional shareholders control 51% of Occidental Petroleum Corporation (NYSE:OXY), making the company's stock price sensitive to their trading decisions. The top 5 shareholders collectively own 53% of the company, with Berkshire Hathaway Inc. being the largest at 27%. While institutional ownership provides credibility, the article cautions against solely relying on it and highlights the influence this group has on company decisions.

feed.title: Occidental Petroleum (OXY): Valuation Insights Following Record Q3 Results and Debt Reduction Progress
feed.summary: Occidental Petroleum (OXY) achieved record Q3 results, exceeding earnings and production forecasts while significantly reducing debt. Despite a mixed stock momentum, the company is seen as 23.7% undervalued with a fair value of $55.05 due to ambitious growth strategies, including significant investments in Carbon Capture, Utilization, and Storage (CCS) technology. However, oil price volatility and the uncertain timeline for CCS profitability pose potential risks.

feed.title: Occidental Petroleum Corp. stock outperforms competitors on strong trading day

feed.title: What's Driving the Market Sentiment Around Occidental Petroleum Corp?
feed.summary: Occidental Petroleum Corp's short interest has decreased by 4.75% according to its latest report, with 36.86 million shares sold short, representing 5.81% of available shares. This decline may indicate a more bullish market sentiment towards OXY, though it doesn't guarantee a near-term price increase. Compared to its peers, Occidental Petroleum still exhibits higher short interest, with its peer group averaging 2.80%.

feed.title: Elgethun Capital Management Takes $5.43 Million Position in Occidental Petroleum Corporation $OXY

feed.title: Occidental Petroleum (OXY) Posts Strong Q3 Earnings, UBS Maintains Neutral Rating
feed.summary: Occidental Petroleum (OXY) reported better-than-expected Q3 earnings for 2025, with cash flow per share surpassing analyst expectations and operating cash flow exceeding $3.2 billion. UBS reaffirmed its Neutral rating and $45 price target, highlighting the company's focus on debt reduction and potential for stock rebound despite underperformance compared to industry rivals. The company aims for debt below $15 billion and expects flat to 2% production growth in 2026.

feed.title: Occidental Petroleum (OXY) Posts Strong Q3 Earnings, UBS Maintains Neutral Rating
feed.summary: Occidental Petroleum (OXY) reported stronger-than-expected Q3 2025 earnings, with operating cash flow exceeding $3.2 billion and a profit of $0.65 per diluted share. UBS maintained its Neutral rating and a $45 price target, noting the company's focus on debt reduction and potential for share rebound. Occidental plans to cut debt to below $15 billion and expects flat to 2% production growth in 2026.

feed.title: 9 Hot Energy Stocks to Buy
feed.summary: This article identifies Coterra Energy Inc. (NYSE:CTRA) as one of 9 hot energy stocks to consider. It highlights UBS's raised price target and Buy rating for CTRA, citing improved capital efficiency and expected production growth. The article also touches on analyst upside, hedge fund holdings, and activist investor attention on Coterra Energy Inc.

feed.title: 9 Hot Energy Stocks to Buy
feed.summary: This article highlights Coterra Energy Inc. (NYSE:CTRA) as one of nine hot energy stocks to consider buying. UBS recently raised its price target for Coterra, citing improved capital efficiency and strong growth projections despite activist investor attention. The company is focused on oil, natural gas, and NGLs development and anticipates significant capital expenditure reductions while increasing output.

feed.title: Unusual Activity in Oracle Corp Put Options Highlights ORCL Stock's Value
feed.summary: Unusual put option activity in Oracle Corp (ORCL), specifically deep out-of-the-money puts expiring in over a year, suggests an expectation of a significant stock price drop. However, the author argues that ORCL stock is undervalued based on its projected operating cash flow and revenue growth, especially given its heavy investments in AI-related operations. These investments, while leading to negative free cash flow currently, are expected to pay off, with price targets from analysts and the author indicating substantial upside potential.

feed.title: Tudor Pickering Holt & Co Adjusts Price Target on Occidental Petroleum to $55 From $56, Maintains Hold Rating
feed.summary: Tudor Pickering Holt & Co has adjusted its price target for Occidental Petroleum (OXY) to $55 from $56, while maintaining a Hold rating on the stock. This update is part of broader analyst coverage of Occidental Petroleum, with several other firms also recently revising their price targets and ratings.
